media:group.media:title: Rethinking Armenia and the diaspora
media:group.media:description:
This week marks the 110th anniversary of the Armenian Genocide. In this week‚Äôs episode of Insights, host Eric Hacopian looks at the legacy of 1915: a powerful yet divided diaspora and a struggling nation-state locked in a dysfunctional relationship. In his discussion of Armenia-Diaspora relations, he explores how ties became so broken, why they matter now more than ever, and what it will take to repair them.
#CivilNet #’ç’´’æ’´’¨’Ü’•’© #insightswitherichacopian

entry.title: Armenia sends new aid package to Syria

media:group.media:title: Armenia sends new aid package to Syria
media:group.media:description:
üìç Armenia will send $125,000 in additional humanitarian aid to Syria. While the amount is modest, the move is notable given Syria's current leadership under Turkish-backed Islamist groups. üìç Armenia has received an invitation to take part in the 3rd Commonwealth of Independent States (CIS) Games, set to be held in Azerbaijan. Yerevan is still undecided whether it will send its athletes. üìç Armenian Parliament Speaker Alen Simonyan said negotiations with Azerbaijan continue and are not stuck in a deadlock.
#CivilNet #’ç’´’æ’´’¨’Ü’•’© #dailyarmenia

entry.title: Erdoƒüan‚Äôs power grab and the myth of Turkish democracy

media:group.media:title: Erdoƒüan‚Äôs power grab and the myth of Turkish democracy
media:group.media:description:
In this interview, political scientist Cengiz Aktar unpacks how Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdoƒüan‚Äôs arrest of Istanbul‚Äôs mayor as part of a long-term strategy to retain power challenges the myth of Turkish democracy. In his discussion of Turkey‚Äôs shifting role in the region, Aktar argues that Ankara is increasingly reliant on Azerbaijan due to economic necessity. In addition, he expresses skepticism about the durability of an Armenia-Azerbaijan normalization deal given Baku's maximalist demands and authoritarian governance.
0:00- What is Erdogan trying to accomplish by arresting Istanbul mayor Ekrem Imamoƒülu 4:03- Myopia over the idea of "Turkish democracy" 7:42- Turkey in Syria: the beginning of the new Ottoman Empire or where dreams go to die? 13:00- Azerbaijani narratives in the Turkish press 18:06- To what extent is the notion of Turkey as a vital defense partner to the West exaggerated? 24:16- Perspective on the normalization agreement between Armenia and Azerbaijan
#CivilNet #’ç’´’æ’´’¨’Ü’•’©

entry.title: Le G√©nocide des Arm√©niens a 110 ans, toujours dans la n√©gation de la Turquie #shorts

media:group.media:title: Le G√©nocide des Arm√©niens a 110 ans, toujours dans la n√©gation de la Turquie #shorts
media:group.media:description:
Ce 24 avril, les Arm√©niens comm√©morent le 110eme anniversaire du Genocide des Arm√©niens.
Une fois par an, en Arm√©nie et dans la diaspora, les Arm√©niens se r√©unissent pour raviver le souvenir des victimes de l‚ÄôEmpire Ottoman.
Le 23 avril, une veill√©e aux chandelles se tient dans les rues d‚ÄôErevan et d‚Äôautres villes majeures d'Arm√©nie. Dans les maisons, les habitants allument une bougie qu'ils posent sur leur fen√™tre en souvenir des vies perdues.
Le lendemain, des milliers d'Arm√©niens se rendent au Tsitsernakaberd, le m√©moriel symbole du genocide de 1915 ou 1,5 millions de vies arm√©niennes ont √©t√© r√©duites √† n√©ant.
Comme chaque ann√©e depuis 110 ans, la Turquie, h√©riti√®re de l‚ÄôEmpire Ottoman, continue de nier les √©v√©nements de 1915.

entry.title: Patrimoine culturel: l‚ÄôAzerba√Ødjan efface la trace des Arm√©niens dans le Haut-Karabakh

media:group.media:title: Patrimoine culturel: l‚ÄôAzerba√Ødjan efface la trace des Arm√©niens dans le Haut-Karabakh
media:group.media:description:
Le rapport de Caucasus Heritage Watch indique que le nombre de sites du patrimoine arm√©nien d√©truits au Haut-Karabakh a explos√© depuis octobre 2023, un mois apr√®s le d√©placement forc√© de la quasi-totalit√© des Arm√©niens de la r√©gion.
Selon le rapport, le nombre total de sites patrimoniaux d√©truits a augment√© de 75 % entre leurs missions de l‚Äôautomne 2023 et du printemps 2024. Le nombre de sites class√©s comme menac√©s a augment√© de 29%.
Depuis la guerre de 44 jours en 2020 qui a oppos√© l‚ÄôArm√©nie et l‚ÄôAzerba√Ødjan et qui a men√© √† la perte de la r√©publique du Haut-Karabakh, Bakou d√©truit et d√©forme le patrimoine culturel des Arm√©niens du Haut-Karabakh. Si rien n‚Äôest fait, l‚ÄôAzerba√Ødjan effacera la trace mill√©naire des Arm√©niens sur leur terre.

entry.title: Scuffle breaks out in Armenia‚Äôs parliament

media:group.media:title: Scuffle breaks out in Armenia‚Äôs parliament
media:group.media:description:
üìç A scuffle broke out in the Armenian parliament this morning between government and opposition deputies. üìç European Union Monitoring Mission observers in Armenia recorded damage to civilian infrastructure in the Armenian border-straddling village of Khoznavar in the southern Syunik region as a result of gunfire from Azerbaijan. üìç Armenian government officials have been conducting what observers say is a hate campaign against displaced Karabakh Armenians. üìç Mr. Sylvain: Teghut‚Äôs Coach from C√¥te d'Ivoire- https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gxIDx9Wa5Bc
#CivilNet #’ç’´’æ’´’¨’Ü’•’© #dailyarmenia

entry.title: Yerevan hosts Ice Hockey World Championship, Division IV

media:group.media:title: Yerevan hosts Ice Hockey World Championship, Division IV
media:group.media:description:
The 2025 International Ice hockey Federation World Championship returns to Armenia for the first time in 15 years.
After being suspended from the Federation in 2010, Armenia has reclaimed its place in the ice hockey scene with Yerevan hosting Division 4 of the Championship. Armenia‚Äôs national team also racked up an impressive record during the week-long tournament.
#CivilNet #’ç’´’æ’´’¨’Ü’•’©

üìç ‘π’•’∞÷Ä’°’∂’® ¬´’¶’£’∏÷Ç’∑’°’æ’∏÷Ä ’¨’°’æ’°’ø’•’Ω’∏÷Ç’©’µ’°’¥’¢ ’ß¬ª ’¥’∏’ø’•’∂’∏÷Ç’¥ ‘±’Ñ’Ü-’´ ’∞’•’ø ’•÷Ä’Ø’≠’∏’Ω’∏÷Ç’©’µ’°’∂’® üìç ‘±÷Ä’°’≤’π’´’∂ ‘ª÷Ä’°’∂’´ ’∞’•’≤’°÷É’∏’≠’∏÷Ç’©’µ’°’∂ ’°’º’°’ª’∂’∏÷Ä’§’´ ’∞’°’ø’∏÷Ç’Ø ’∂’°’¥’°’Ø’∂ ’ß ÷É’∏’≠’°’∂÷Å’•’¨ ’ä’∏÷Ç’ø’´’∂’´’∂ üìç ’Ñ’∏’Ω’Ø’æ’°’∂ ’æ’°’æ’•÷Ä’°÷Å÷Ä’•’¨ ’ß ‘ª÷Ä’°’∂’´ ’∞’•’ø ’Ω’ø’∏÷Ä’°’£÷Ä’æ’°’Æ ¬´’å’°’¶’¥’°’æ’°÷Ä’°’Ø’°’∂ ’£’∏÷Ä’Æ’®’∂’Ø’•÷Ä’∏÷Ç’©’µ’°’∂¬ª ’¥’°’Ω’´’∂ ÷É’°’Ω’ø’°’©’∏÷Ç’≤’©’®
’è’•’Ω’°’∂’µ’∏÷Ç’©’® ’∫’°’ø÷Ä’°’Ω’ø’•’¨’´’Ω ÷Ö’£’ø’æ’•’¨ ’•’∂÷Ñ ’µ’∏÷Ç’©’∏÷Ç’¢’µ’°’∂ ’∞’•’ø÷á’µ’°’¨ ’°’¨’´÷Ñ’∂’•÷Ä’´÷Å mehrnews, Rasadkadeh - ÿ±ÿµÿØ⁄©ÿØŸá, Reuters, Forbes Breaking News, Times Of India,
